image.altText: A tight head and shoulders shot of Senator Linda Reynolds looking at the camera outside court.

props.synopsis: A clumsily crafted bot network posting about the Linda Reynolds and Brittany Higgins defamation trial likely originated from foreign influencers wielding culturally divisive topics to sow discord, an ABC NEWS Verify analysis finds.

title.children: Seven red flags we identified about the X accounts posting about Reynolds's defamation trial

image.altText: A man with sunglasses stands looking at the camera smiling

props.synopsis: Dougie Hampson died less than 24 hours after he was misdiagnosed with a cannabis-related syndrome and discharged from Dubbo hospital in August 2021.

title.children: Doctor's misdiagnosis led to 'preventable' death of Indigenous man

image.altText: A woman in a tan dress looks serious.

props.synopsis: The bombshell decision of Brittany Higgins's legal team not to call the former political staffer to give evidence in her defence has shocked those following her defamation trial with Linda Reynolds. Here's what the move means for the rest of the trial.

title.children: Here's what Brittany Higgins's decision not to testify means for the Linda Reynolds defamation trial

image.altText: A woman puts her hand over her heart while smiling

props.synopsis: On a night that was meant to be a celebration of his bid for a second term, Joe Biden was moved to tears as he endorsed Kamala Harris. Here's what you missed from day one of the Democratic Convention.

title.children: On day one of the Democratic Convention, Kamala breaks with tradition to address the elephant in the room

props.synopsis: The Australian Securities and Investment Commission has released a report on how 15 of the country’s banks are responding to an unprecedented increase in scams.

title.children: New report finds bank scam victims bear the burden 96 per cent of the time

image.altText: A composite image of two soldiers, soldiers firing a have weapon, and a brain scan

props.synopsis: Doctors suspect mysterious brain injuries in soldiers repeatedly exposed to blasts and explosions could be the cause of memory loss, headaches, fits of rage and an increased suicide risk.

title.children: How firing their own weapons has put Australia's soldiers at risk of brain injury

image.altText: Prabowo Subianto and Anthony Albanese shake hands during a press conference.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese announces Australia and Indonesia have finalised negotiations on an upgraded defence agreement which the federal government is hailing as the "most significant" pact the two countries have ever signed.

title.children: Incoming Indonesian president stresses 'non-alignment' after finalising defence agreement with Australia

image.altText: First responders arrive at the scene of a Greyhound bus collision on Bruce Highway.

props.synopsis: A 52-year-old bus driver from Townsville is charged with five counts of dangerous driving causing death or grievous bodily harm over a crash that killed three people in June.

title.children: Bus driver charged over triple-fatal Bruce Highway crash

image.altText: A diver prepares to hop off a boat

props.synopsis: Six people are missing, including a man dubbed the British Bill Gates, after a luxury yacht sank off the Sicilian coast.

title.children: A tech mogul, a luxury yacht and a work cruise gone awry: What we know about the Bayesian sinking

props.synopsis: In Australia, there are more than twice as many children as childcare places, according to a world-first study analysing childcare access down to the street level in nine developed countries.

title.children: Australia's childcare divide is growing. Here are the suburbs getting left behind

image.altText: A close up shot of a woman with short grey hair in front of flags.

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong has given a rare and unvarnished account of how she's grappled with racial discrimination and self-doubt in public life.

title.children: 'It felt daunting, to so often be the first': Wong reflects on being Asian-Australian in parliament

image.altText: Herald Sun AFL and cricket writer Sam Landsberg has died.

props.synopsis: Tributes are pouring in for the 35-year-old Herald Sun and Fox Footy journalist, who has died after being struck by a truck in Richmond on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Football journalist Sam Landsberger killed in collision at Melbourne intersection

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: The federal government has offered political staffers the maximum pay rise allowed under government rules, along with new travel allowances, leave for cultural activities and extra pay for staff who speak multiple languages.

title.children: Parliamentary staff poised for pay rise with new cultural leave and travel allowances

image.altText: Australian cyclist Matthew Richardson cheering in delight on his bike after winning a race

props.synopsis: Commonwealth Games gold medallist and Olympian Katherine Bates says cyclist Matthew Richardson's defection to Great Britain is "a break-up you never saw coming".

title.children: Australian athletes feeling 'ripped off' after cyclist's defection to Team Great Britain

image.altText: A man an woman share in a selfie in front of a bridge

props.synopsis: Ross Johnston looked after Christine like she was his granddaughter. When he came to collect her possessions from her country Victorian home he was floored by some of the stories her friends told him about their workplaces.

title.children: Christine worked in Australia to provide her Fijian family a better life. Her death sparked an international investigation

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entrance.

props.synopsis: Two juries could not reach a verdict in Imaran Kader's rape trials, but he later pleaded guilty to perjury and attempting to pervert the course of justice when it was revealed he asked his former partner to support his lie.

title.children: Former Canberra doctor, tried twice for alleged rape, tells appeals court perjury sentence excessive

image.altText: wide shot of run down building in Geraldton

props.synopsis: David Ambrosius, 48, reoffended just hours after being released from prison. He had requested his time behind bars be extended at sentencing on Monday, citing his inability to access proper support in the community.

title.children: Homeless man reoffends after asking for two years in jail amid housing crisis

image.altText: The Assembly. Guest Sam Neill. Ep 1. Image courtesy of ABC.6559

props.synopsis: The legendary actor says, at the time, he didn't think the movie would be funny but "could not [have been] more wrong".

title.children: Actor Sam Neill shares the iconic Aussie film role he turned down

image.altText: Man working from home in a creative field on his ipad

props.synopsis: New laws come into effect next week that give workers the right to ignore work communications after hours, but they may not be enough to shift Australians' habit of working long hours.

title.children: Australians will soon have the right to switch off after hours — but it might not shift our 'excessive' work culture

image.altText: Untitled design (4)

props.synopsis: Sovereign citizens are using tax time to spread misinformation about the Australian Taxation Office, including the claim "tax is voluntary" and the authority is "not a legal entity".

title.children: Sovereign citizens warned off using 'hopelessly flawed' logic during tax time

image.altText: Discoloured tomatoes with spots

props.synopsis: The disease that affects the production of tomato, capsicum and chilli crops has been detected in the major vegetable growing area of the northern Adelaide Plains.

title.children: Infected seeds bring fruit virus into Australia for first time

image.altText: Still from Bluey Grannies episode with characters looking at coins fallen on the ground

props.synopsis: A second person has been arrested and charged by NSW Police over an alleged theft that saw more than half-a-million-dollars worth of limited edition Bluey coins stolen from a Western Sydney warehouse.

title.children: Second person charged over theft of $600k worth of exclusive Bluey 'dollarbucks'

image.altText: A photograph of a streetscape in the central business district of regional city Kalgoorlie.

props.synopsis: City of Kalgoorlie-Boulder councillors vote against the introduction of unrestricted trading hours but agree to extend retail hours.

title.children: Historic mining city votes against introducing unrestricted trading hours

image.altText: A composite image showing a small black beetle next to a tree stump with tunneling damage.

props.synopsis: The invasive shot-hole borer beetle has been found outside Perth's quarantine zone, sparking fears it could spread to the east coast.

title.children: 'Incredibly concerning': Invasive tree pest found outside quarantine zone

image.altText: Sofia

props.synopsis: From country to country, keen sky gazers have diligently captured the first supermoon of the year.

title.children: Rare 'blue' sturgeon supermoon lights up global landmarks

image.altText: A reflection of people walking past the ASX indicator board.

props.synopsis: Two weeks ago, fear that global finance was on the eve of destruction caused a wave of panic as traders from New York to Tokyo battled one another in a race to exit financial markets. Now it's but a distant memory.

title.children: What did we learn from this month's stock market crash? Nothing

image.altText: A female mine worker walks past a mine dump truck at a coal mine in central Queensland.

props.synopsis: Workers are being asked to undergo blood tests as part of the recruitment process, particularly in the mining and resources sectors, with no guarantee their health information is secure, a new report has found.

title.children: 'No blood, no job': The companies ruling out job applicants who refuse to take blood tests

image.altText: A stylised image of a mother cradling a baby.

props.synopsis: Leaked documents obtained by ABC News show child protection workers regularly breached government policy when removing newborns at one of Adelaide's public maternity hospitals.

title.children: Midwives ordered to stop mothers breastfeeding before 'unethical' newborn removals, documents reveal

image.altText: a man in a pale blue suit outside court

props.synopsis: The 54-year-old is accused of assault, strangulation and burglary relating to several incidents in the Noosa region between December 2023 and early this year.

title.children: Former Test cricketer Michael Slater denied bail on domestic violence charges

image.altText: Larry Emdur on the red carpet holding up his gold Logie award

props.synopsis: With a streaming title sweeping the awards to a convoluted voting process, the 2024 Logies shows how Australian TV is struggling to keep up with a rapidly changing industry.

title.children: The Logies proved that the one-time cultural heartbeat of Australia is facing arrest

image.altText: large orange and white venomous sea snail, a textile cone, in a rockpool in Minnie Water

props.synopsis: Marine specialists say NSW residents should learn to identify venomous cone shells, with populations tipped to increase due to global warming.

title.children: Sighting of rare venomous sea snail in rock pool sparks warnings

image.altText: A boy with scabs on his face

props.synopsis: Sewage seeping through the streets of Gaza is prompting a new infectious threat to desperate Palestinians.

title.children: 'We've never seen anything like this': Doctors baffled by skin infections spreading through Gaza

image.altText: Woman with blonde hair sits next to man with short brown hair at a cafe with yellow coffee mugs.

props.synopsis: Choosing to walk away was the hardest decision, but for these farming couples, there's a new life beyond the family property.

title.children: 'You only live once': Trading in the family farm for a different life

image.altText: Six young people smiling stand in front of a purple background, with a logo located in the top left corner saying 'Trailblazers'

props.synopsis: The ABC is calling on individuals or groups of up to three, aged 18-28, who have started social, educational, environmental, and economic development projects in their regional communities.

title.children: Trailblazers share 'incredible' experiences and encourage others to apply

image.altText: A photograph of a nebula in space with orange, blue and white swirls of gas, surrounded by stars

props.synopsis: Award-winning writers Ceridwen Dovey and Alicia Sometimes use space as a setting to explore what it means to be human in their new books.

title.children: How writing about space helped these two authors through their cancer treatment
